A mulch is natural or artificially spread layer of plant residues or other materials on the surface of soil. The word “mulch” is derived from Germanic term mulch means soft to decay which apparently refer to the use of organic material and agricultural waste like straw, grass clippings, compost and leaves spread over the ground as mulch.

The important objectives of mulching in agriculture are:
 1. Moisture conservation
 2. Soil temperature control
 3. Weed control
 4.Prevention of surface compaction
 5.Reduction of runoff and erosion
 6.Improvement in soil structure and wheat control

After preparation of permanent raised beds with such design which will allow excess rainfall to run off the mulch. The mulch of our choice is covered or laid on the designed beds. Usually 2 – 4 Inch layer of organic mulch is used to cover the beds. Spread mulch equally on bed.

Hardpan or ouklip is a dense layer of soil, usually found below the uppermost topsoil layer. There are different types of hardpan, all sharing the general characteristic of being a distinct soil layer that is largely impervious to water.

1.Deposits of Sodium, dissolved Silica or rust/limestone combinations
2.Heavy machinery or livestock traffic
3.Repeated plowing, particularly at the same depth every year

1.Once a layer of hardpan forms, no water can penetrate the soil beyond that level. Any moisture that reaches the hardpan layer will simply run off.

2.Roots cannot enter the hardpan, either. Once a probing root tip feels the hardpan, it will turn aside, directing root growth horizontally. Or, worse yet, the plant will give up growing roots altogether.
1. On a small scale, this is typically done with a broadfork.\n\n2. On a larger scale, a variety of animal- or tractor-powered tools are available, such as Fixed- Tine Chisel Plow 18-20 inch deep.

Organic matter (or organic material) is matter that has come from a recently living organism. Materials that go through the decomposition process to form soil organic matter include: crop and plant residues, tree litter, animal waste, animals and different types of soil organisms, their by-products and to a lesser extent human waste.

1.Improve soil structure
2.Improves drainage
3.Holds moisture
4.Provides nutrients
5.Improves cation exchange capacity
How to increase Soil Organic Matter?

1.Grow perennial pasture
2.Grow cereal crops
3.Grow green manure crops
4.Spread manure
5.Use organic fertilizers
6.Keep cultivation to a minimum
7.Concentrate organic matter

Soil washing is a remediation technique that removes hazardous contaminants from soil by washing the soil with a liquid (often with a chemical additive and then separating the clean soils from contaminated soil and wash with water.

For soil wash follow these steps:

1.Perform plough with the Chisel Plow

2.Spread the Sulfuric acid or Sulphur equally over the soil (about 8 – 10 kg per acre)

3.Properly irrigate the land.\n
